page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY-BLEWBURY
page.content: BLEWBURY HAS A GOOD SET OF MANORIAL COURT ROLLS FROM THE EARLY PART OF THE EIGHTEENTH CENTURY.CONSEQUENTLY,MANY COPYHOLD PROPERTIES CAN BE TRACED BACK TO THAT TIME AS FAR AS OWNERSHIP IS CONCERNED.UNFORTUNATELY A LOCAL FAMILY,WHO BOUGHT WHO BOUGHT THE LORDSHIP OF THE MANOR IN 1762,ALREADY HELD A GREAT DEAL OF COPY HOLD LAND AT THIS DATE AND THESE BECAME ABSORBED INTO THE LORD'S FREE- HOLD.THE FOLLOWING ARE A FEW DETAILS OF HOUSES AND GARDENS OPENED TO THE PUBLIC DURING THE FESTIVAL HELD EVERY TWO YEARS: BROOKSIDE,WESTBROOK STREET:FREEHOLD PROPERTY OF THE LORD OF THE MANOR.ONE OF THE VILLAGE MIDWIVES USED TO LIVE THERE AT THE END OF THE LAST CENTURY. BORLESE GALLERY,SOUTH STREET:HAS BEEN IN THE SAME FAMILY FOR THE LAST 200 YEARS.LATER MEMBERS WERE WHEELWRIGHTS.
